snippet: The December employment report was an upbeat finish to 2011. But without government support, even modest job gains cannot be sustained.
abstract: Editorial asserts that in order to sustain even the modest job growth reported in December 2011, the government will have to do more; holds that at a minimum, Congress needs to extend federal unemployment benefits and the payroll tax cut beyond their expiration in late February.
lead_paragraph: The December employment report was an upbeat finish to 2011. But without government support, even modest job gains cannot be sustained.
